segment.source: Configuring UE-V with Group Policy Objects
segment.target: Configuring UE-V with Group Policy Objects

segment.source: Configuring UE-V with Group Policy Objects
segment.target: Configuring UE-V with Group Policy Objects

segment.source: Configuring UE-V with Group Policy Objects
segment.target: Configuring UE-V with Group Policy Objects

segment.source: Some Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) Group Policy settings can be defined for computers and others can be defined for users.
segment.target: Some Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) Group Policy settings can be defined for computers and others can be defined for users.

segment.source: UE-V agent configuration policy settings can be defined for computers or users.
segment.target: UE-V agent configuration policy settings can be defined for computers or users.

segment.source: For information about how to install UE-V Group Policy ADMX files, see Installing the UE-V Group Policy ADMX Templates.
segment.target: For information about how to install UE-V Group Policy ADMX files, see Installing the UE-V Group Policy ADMX Templates.

segment.source: The following policy settings can be configured for UE-V:
segment.target: The following policy settings can be configured for UE-V:

segment.source: Policy setting name
segment.target: Policy setting name

segment.source: Target
segment.target: Target

segment.source: Policy setting description
segment.target: Policy setting description

segment.source: Configuration options
segment.target: Configuration options

segment.source: Use User Experience Virtualization (UE-V)
segment.target: Use User Experience Virtualization (UE-V)

segment.source: Computers and Users
segment.target: Computers and Users

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to enable or disable User Experience Virtualization (UE-V).
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to enable or disable User Experience Virtualization (UE-V).

segment.source: Enable or disable this policy setting.
segment.target: Enable or disable this policy setting.

segment.source: Settings storage path
segment.target: Settings storage path

segment.source: Computers and Users
segment.target: Computers and Users

segment.source: This policy setting configures where the user settings will be stored.
segment.target: This policy setting configures where the user settings will be stored.

segment.source: Provide a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path and variables such as Server\SettingsShareusername%.
segment.target: Provide a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path and variables such as Server\SettingsShareusername%.

segment.source: Settings template catalog path
segment.target: Settings template catalog path

segment.source: Computers Only
segment.target: Computers Only

segment.source: This policy setting configures where custom settings location templates are stored.
segment.target: This policy setting configures where custom settings location templates are stored.

segment.source: This policy setting also configures whether the catalog will be used to replace the default Microsoft templates that are installed with the UE-V agent.
segment.target: This policy setting also configures whether the catalog will be used to replace the default Microsoft templates that are installed with the UE-V agent.

segment.source: Provide a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path such as Server\TemplateShare or a folder location on the computer.
segment.target: Provide a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path such as Server\TemplateShare or a folder location on the computer.

segment.source: Select the check box to replace the default Microsoft templates.
segment.target: Select the check box to replace the default Microsoft templates.

segment.source: Do not use Offline Files
segment.target: Do not use Offline Files

segment.source: Computers and Users
segment.target: Computers and Users

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to configure whether UE-V will use the Windows Offline Files feature.
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to configure whether UE-V will use the Windows Offline Files feature.

segment.source: This policy setting also allows you to enable notification to occur when the import of user settings is delayed.
segment.target: This policy setting also allows you to enable notification to occur when the import of user settings is delayed.

segment.source: To configure the UE-V Agent to not use offline files, enable this setting.
segment.target: To configure the UE-V Agent to not use offline files, enable this setting.

segment.source: Specify if notifications should be given when settings import is delayed.
segment.target: Specify if notifications should be given when settings import is delayed.

segment.source: Specify the length of time in seconds to wait before the notification appears.
segment.target: Specify the length of time in seconds to wait before the notification appears.

segment.source: Synchronization timeout
segment.target: Synchronization timeout

segment.source: Computers and Users
segment.target: Computers and Users

segment.source: This policy setting configures the number of milliseconds that the computer waits before a timeout when retrieving user settings from the remote settings location.
segment.target: This policy setting configures the number of milliseconds that the computer waits before a timeout when retrieving user settings from the remote settings location.

segment.source: If the remote storage location is unavailable, the application launch is delayed by this many milliseconds.
segment.target: If the remote storage location is unavailable, the application launch is delayed by this many milliseconds.

segment.source: Specify the preferred synchronization timeout in milliseconds.
segment.target: Specify the preferred synchronization timeout in milliseconds.

segment.source: The default value of 2000 milliseconds.
segment.target: The default value of 2000 milliseconds.

segment.source: Package size warning threshold
segment.target: Package size warning threshold

segment.source: Computers and Users
segment.target: Computers and Users

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to configure the UE-V agent to report when a settings package file size reaches a defined threshold.
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to configure the UE-V agent to report when a settings package file size reaches a defined threshold.

segment.source: Specified the preferred threshold for settings package sizes in kilobytes.
segment.target: Specified the preferred threshold for settings package sizes in kilobytes.

segment.source: By default, the UE-V agent does not have a package file size threshold.
segment.target: By default, the UE-V agent does not have a package file size threshold.

segment.source: Roaming Application settings
segment.target: Roaming Application settings

segment.source: Users Only
segment.target: Users Only

segment.source: This policy setting configures the roaming of user settings of applications.
segment.target: This policy setting configures the roaming of user settings of applications.

segment.source: Select which Windows settings will roam between computers.
segment.target: Select which Windows settings will roam between computers.

segment.source: By default, the user settings of applications with settings template provided by UE-V are roamed between computers.
segment.target: By default, the user settings of applications with settings template provided by UE-V are roamed between computers.

segment.source: Roaming Windows settings
segment.target: Roaming Windows settings

segment.source: Users Only
segment.target: Users Only

segment.source: This policy setting configures the roaming of Windows settings.
segment.target: This policy setting configures the roaming of Windows settings.

segment.source: Select which applications will roam between computers.
segment.target: Select which applications will roam between computers.

segment.source: By default, Windows themes are roamed between computers of the same operating system version.
segment.target: By default, Windows themes are roamed between computers of the same operating system version.

segment.source: Windows desktop settings and Ease of Access settings are not roamed.
segment.target: Windows desktop settings and Ease of Access settings are not roamed.

segment.source: To configure computer-targeted policies
segment.target: To configure computer-targeted policies

segment.source: Use the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) on the domain controller computer that manages Group Policy for UE-V computers.
segment.target: Use the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) on the domain controller computer that manages Group Policy for UE-V computers.

segment.source: Navigate to Computer configuration, select Policies, select Administrative Templates, click Windows Components, and then select Microsoft User Experience Virtualization.
segment.target: Navigate to Computer configuration, select Policies, select Administrative Templates, click Windows Components, and then select Microsoft User Experience Virtualization.

segment.source: Select the policy setting to be edited.
segment.target: Select the policy setting to be edited.

segment.source: To configure user-targeted policies
segment.target: To configure user-targeted policies

segment.source: Use the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) tool in Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP) on the domain controller computer that manages Group Policy for UE-V.
segment.target: Use the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) tool in Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP) on the domain controller computer that manages Group Policy for UE-V.

segment.source: Navigate to User configuration, select Policies, select Administrative Templates, click Windows Components, and then select Microsoft User Experience Virtualization.
segment.target: Navigate to User configuration, select Policies, select Administrative Templates, click Windows Components, and then select Microsoft User Experience Virtualization.

segment.source: Select the policy setting edited.
segment.target: Select the policy setting edited.

segment.source: The UE-V agent uses the following order of precedence to determine synchronization.
segment.target: The UE-V agent uses the following order of precedence to determine synchronization.

segment.source: Order of precedence for UE-V settings
segment.target: Order of precedence for UE-V settings

segment.source: User-targeted settings managed by Group Policy - These configuration settings are stored in the registry key by Group Policy under .
segment.target: User-targeted settings managed by Group Policy - These configuration settings are stored in the registry key by Group Policy under .

segment.source: Computer-targeted settings managed by Group Policy - These configuration settings are stored in the registry key by Group Policy under .
segment.target: Computer-targeted settings managed by Group Policy - These configuration settings are stored in the registry key by Group Policy under .

segment.source: Configuration settings defined by the current user using PowerShell or WMI - These configuration settings are stored by the UE-V agent under this registry location: .
segment.target: Configuration settings defined by the current user using PowerShell or WMI - These configuration settings are stored by the UE-V agent under this registry location: .

segment.source: Configuration settings defined for the computer using PowerShell or WMI.
segment.target: Configuration settings defined for the computer using PowerShell or WMI.

segment.source: These configuration settings are stored by the UE-V agent under the .
segment.target: These configuration settings are stored by the UE-V agent under the .
